channel.title: pyroscope on Nicole van der Hoeven
channel.description: Recent content in pyroscope on Nicole van der Hoeven

item.title: State of the Observability Databases (Grafana Office Hours #30)
item.description: In this Grafana Office Hours, we talk about the state of observability databases (Grafana Loki, Mimir, Tempo, and Pyroscope) and where they’re going. We talk about current and upcoming architectural changes in all four, how we’re making them more performant, how compatible they are with OpenTelemetry, and what we’re working on next for each database. In this conversation are Dee Kitchen (VP of Engineering for Databases) and Senior Developer Advocates Jay Clifford and Nicole van der Hoeven.

item.title: How to do continuous profiling right with Grafana Pyroscope and Ryan Perry, (Grafana Office Hours #26)
item.description:
My friend Paul Balogh and I interview Ryan Perry, co-founder of Grafana Pyroscope, about how to do continuous profiling right. Ryan, and the rest of the Pyroscope team, joined Grafana Labs, where he is now a Director of Engineer. Ryan discusses the main concerns in continuous profiling and how to avoid those pitfalls. Pyroscope is an open-source project for aggregating continuous profiling data about your system’s resources.

Links

  • Pyroscope docs
  • Pyroscope site
  • Pyroscope repo
  • Weigh in on the OpenTelemetry Profiling Data Model

item.title: (ES) Inicia (Café con Grafana #000)
item.description: Tenemos un nuevo show para toda la comunidad de habla en Español! En el vamos a estar invitando a Grafanaistas, Champions, Entusiastas y a miembros de la comunidad. Aquí vamos a compartir experiencias, conocimientos, perspectivas, diversion y mucho Español!
